clues.text: It's an operator-assisted call in which charges are paid by the receiving party
This hyphenated adjective refers to a phone call requiring no additional fee beyond the basic service charge
Often used in business, it's a multi-person call involving 3 or more phone lines
Reflecting the company's activities at its founding in 1885, it was the second "T" in AT&T
To dial international numbers from the U.S., begin with this 3-digit prefix
Jean Valjean's flight through Paris' sewers is one of the most famous scenes in this novel
Chicago's Packingtown is the scene of this muckraking novel
This house on the moors in Yorkshire had "Earnshaw" carved over the door
This saucy Defoe title character was born in Newgate Prison
With the help of his wife O-Lan, Wang Lung goes from peasant to rich landowner in China in this novel
Because of slow sales, this company shut down plants that made the Denali & Trailblazer SUVs
The Fortwo is a model of this little putt-putt, the "intelligent" choice in low-emission transportation
This Korean company recently introduced a Sonata hybrid
Autoweek says the Viper from this car maker is fun, intimidating & flamboyant
Since its launch in 1974, this "sport"y VW model has ruled the sales charts in Germany
"I Love You, Ronnie" is a collection of letters to his wife Nancy
In a 1783 letter to Josiah Quincy, he wrote "There was never a good war or a bad peace"
In the late '40s a mother wrote to this artist that his picture "Number Nine" looked like some of her son's finger painting
Before he began courting, he wrote in an 1845 letter, "I love your verses with all my heart, dear Miss Barrett"
In 1897 she wrote, "Dear Editor:  I am 8 years old.  Some of my little friends say there is no Santa Claus"
Whether it's CSI or CSU, the CS stands for this
If a policeman says he wasn't greeted at the door because the occupant was DOA, he's abbreviating these 3 words
The M.E. says the C.O.D. is bad clams, C.O.D. meaning this
GSR means this kind of residue, perhaps on a perp's hand
A criminal's method of operating (or M.O.) sounds much cooler when it's this Latin phrase
In "Scarface", this actor terrorized Miami as the coke-fueled crime lord Tony Montana
Forget Hannibal Lecter; Buffalo Bill is the bad guy who keeps his victims in a pit in this movie
This character is the crazy, relentless killer in the "Halloween" movies
Jack Torrance is the writer & axeman who goes mad at an off-season hotel in this 1980 film
Robert De Niro & Robert Mitchum both played Max Cady, out to get revenge in the 2 versions of this film
In 1977 he became the first veep to move into the vice president's current official residence
Pinch-pitching for this man, his boss, in 1912 James Sherman became the first VP to make an opening day baseball toss
She was the first woman nominated for vice president by a major party
He was the first vice president to assume the presidency upon the death of a president
He was the first (& only) veep to assume the presidency under the provisions of the 25th amendment

rounds.comments: (Alex: We want you to name the album for us.)

clues.text:
1982:
"The Lady In My Life",
"Billie Jean"

1984:
"Glory Days",
"Dancing In The Dark"

1976:
"Life In The Fast Lane",
"New Kid In Town"

1986:
"Diamonds On The Soles Of Her Shoes",
"You Can Call Me Al"

1987:
"Welcome To The Jungle",
"Sweet Child O' Mine"
Armed with just a sling & some pebbles, David took out this Philistine giant
A trebuchet, a medieval weapon with a sling for hurling missiles, worked much like this playground apparatus
In the 16th c., both the Incas & these Nahuatl-speaking people used the sling against Spanish conquistadors
This sign of the zodiac is sometimes represented by an arrow drawn across a bow
The English army's slings & spears were effective at this battle, but it ended for Harold II with an arrow in the eye
"Queen of Mean", indeed: her will gave her grandkids nothing but left $12 million in a trust fund for her dog
Talk about throwing your money away: ex-Tyco CEO Dennis Kozlowski spent $2,200 on a gilt metal one of these
In 2003 Calvin Klein paid $30 million for a mansion in the "south" one of these Long Island enclaves; now he's tearing it down
In August 2009 the sultan of this spent $21,000 to get a trim from his favorite hairdresser
So many choices: this Philippine first lady had 508 floor-length gowns to wear with her 1,060 pairs of shoes
"Hud"
"Dr. Strangelove"
"Saving Private Ryan"
"What's Eating Gilbert Grape?"
"The Good, the Bad & the Ugly" (all 3, per favore)
clues.response: Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef & Eli Wallach

clues.text: Victoria is the capital of this Pacific coast province
Halifax, the capital of this province, is the home port of the Canadian Atlantic fleet
Winnie-the-Pooh was named after a bear owned by a WWI soldier from this Manitoba city
Charlottetown, the capital of this island province, is named for the wife of King George III
Iqaluit, the capital of this territory created in 1999, means "place of fish" in the Inuktitut language

rounds.text: These 2 presidents from the same state were the 1st two presidents to serve just 1 term each
